title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Volkswagen CEO: tariffs have cost group billions so far
items.summary:
- *Tariffs* have cost Volkswagen Group several *billion euros* so far this year, according to CEO *Oliver Blume*. 
- He noted the US tariffs remain high (27.5%) with talks of a 15% cut and mentioned possible tax breaks for planned investments, including a local Audi plant. 
- Blume described VW as in a *sandwich* between faltering *China* and the *US*, pressuring Porsche and Audi.

items.title: Vikram Solar bags 336 MW Khavda order
items.summary:
- **Vikram Solar** bags a 336 MW module order from *L&T Construction* for the Khavda project in Gujarat.  
- The order uses **Hypersol G12R** N-type modules to boost BOS efficiency and reduce the **LCOE**.  
- Vikram Solar previously secured a 326 MW order from *GIPCL* for the Khavda Renewable Energy Park in May 2025.

items.title: LG Electronics IPO in India this October
items.author: Himadri Buch, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- LG Electronics is set to launch its India IPO in *October*, targeting about *₹15,000 crore*.
- The issue will comprise around *10.2 crore shares* (about *15%* of the local arm), making it the largest IPO in 2025 so far.
- Lead managers include *Morgan Stanley India*, *JP Morgan India*, *Axis Capital*, *BofA Securities India*, and *Citigroup Global Markets India* as market momentum remains bullish.

items.title: LG Electronics IPO in India this October
items.author: Himadri Buch, ET Bureau
items.summary: - *LG Electronics* plans to launch its Indian IPO in October, aiming to raise ₹15,000 crore, the largest in 2025 so far.\n- It will offer **15%** stake or **10.2 crore** shares, with Sebi approval and leading banks such as Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan, BofA Securities, and Citi as book-running lead managers.\n- The delay from spring was due to volatility and global headwinds; October is viewed as the right window amid a busy IPO pipeline.

items.title: FMCG firms urge sale of old MRP packs after GST cuts
items.summary:
- *FMCG firms* are urging the government to allow selling stock at lower prices using existing MRP packaging after the GST cuts take effect.
- They warn about discarding packaging worth over ₹2,000 crore and propose using pre-printed stock with ads informing consumers about the new prices to limit wastage.
- They also seek rounding MRPs to the nearest rupee/50 paise and to treat promo offers as valid tax benefits to ease implementation.

items.title: BJP MPs urge pass-on of GST cut to consumers
items.summary: - The resolution urges manufacturers and traders to pass-on every *GST* saving to the **One Nation, One Tax** vision benefiting the *consumer*.\n- Lower prices will fuel higher demand, boosting prosperity for businesses and strengthening trust between shopkeepers and customers.\n- *GST* reforms simplify the system, reduce essentials prices and show rising revenue collection as proof of greater compliance and growth.

items.title: ACME Solar orders 2 GWh Battery Energy Storage
items.summary:
- ACME Solar orders a *2 GWh Battery Energy Storage System* from Chuzhou Lishen New Energy Technology with POSCO International and China FAW Group, for ACME's *FDRE* and standalone *BESS* projects.
- Delivery will be phased over *6–10 months*, with commissioning in *12–18 months*, bringing cumulative BESS procurement to over *5 GWh* after the prior *3.1 GWh* order in July 2025.
- Nikhil Dhingra, CEO of ACME Solar, calls it a strategic procurement that strengthens ties with *POSCO International* and *Lishen* in India's growing BESS market.

items.title: India’s graphite gets zero duty access in US, but conditions apply
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- The US exempts Indian-origin *graphite* from tariffs, giving India a cost edge in the growing *EV battery* supply chain. 
- The exemption is conditional on a **framework agreement** with enforceable commitments to fair and reciprocal trade and alignment with US security priorities. 
- Long-term gains depend on India securing the agreement to attract investment and diversify the global supply chain away from China.

items.title: Trump urges legal hiring after Hyundai raid; 300 workers
items.author: Divyadeep Singh, ET Bureau
items.summary: - Following the Hyundai Georgia raid that detained 475 workers, *Trump* urged foreign companies to bring their skills to the U.S. **legally** and to hire and train American workers.\n- He said foreign manufacturing experts could be allowed to help train U.S. workers, but stressed the alliance with **South Korea** should stay intact.\n- South Korea plans to bring home **300 detained workers**, with a charter flight and talks led by the foreign minister.

items.title: Goa's waste-to-biogas plant runs 9 years: CM
items.summary:
- *Goa* is the first state to set up a municipal solid waste to **biogas** and **biogas to energy** plant, now operating for nine years.
- The CM noted Goa has transported five lakh tonnes of refuse-derived fuel to cement plants, saving **three lakh tonnes of coal**, and pioneered the **deposit refund scheme** for **multi-layered plastic waste**.
- A biomass network under **Goa Energy Development Agency (GEDA)** includes a 40 TPD plant at Saligao and a biomass-aggregation portal to support horticulturists and local bodies, with plans to convert more plastics to fuel.

items.title: GST cut to boost private investment in biogas sector
Companies reset sustainability goals amid extreme weather surge
BPCL gets clearance to draft ToR for ₹1.03 lakh crore refinery-petrochem project in Andhra Pradesh
ChrysCapital, InCred Invest ₹1,200 Cr in ILJIN Electronics
items.summary:
- ILJIN Electronics India, Amber Group's electronics arm, raised *₹1,200 crore* in strategic funding from **ChrysCapital** and **InCred Growth Partners Fund I**, with *₹1,100 crore* from ChrysCapital and *₹100 crore* from InCred. 
- This is ILJIN's first external institutional capital raise, enabling scale-up of operations and potential acquisitions to strengthen its *PCB* and *EMS* leadership. 
- Amber Group also highlighted expansion moves into energy storage and industrial automation, with deals like **Power-One Micro Systems** and **Unitronics plc** to grow in *EV charging*, *BESS*, and related segments.

items.title: Indian semicon consortium bags deal for 5 lakh cameras
items.author: Suraksha P, ETtech
items.summary: - **Kaynes Semicon-led consortium**, with partners like NXP Semiconductors and CDAC, has won contracts to supply over 5 lakh indigenous dash and surveillance cameras by year-end. - These cameras are the *first in India* to be engineered, packaged, and produced locally, with **50% localisation by 2026** and **90% by 2030**. - CEO Raghu Panicker says the project aims to build a *scalable India-based hardware ecosystem*.

items.title: Govt to fast-track next round of India Semiconductor Mission
items.summary:
- The government plans to fast-track *ISM 2.0* approval, with a cabinet note by end-October and applications by year-end.
- *ISM 2.0* would broaden support to the full semiconductor value chain—*compound semiconductor fabs*, advanced packaging, display fabs, capital equipment, chemicals & gases, and fabless design.
- Industry is pushing for a higher outlay and a stronger local supply chain, with subsidies varying by category and ISM 1.0 projects moving toward domestic sourcing.

items.title: ASML becomes Mistral AI's top shareholder after leading latest funding round
Africa's solar potential fuels renewables future
items.summary:
- Africa holds *60%* of the world's best **solar resources**, yet only *2%* of global clean energy investments in 2024, leaving hundreds of millions without electricity. 
- Ambitious goals like **300 GW by 2030** and up to **90% renewables by 2050**, with projects such as the **KHI Solar One**, show a path to broad electrification through solar. 
- The Africa Climate Summit and rising solar trade signal faster deployment that could boost health, education and economic growth across the continent.

items.title: Steel industry seeks AI in value chain for green financing
items.summary: - The two-day Steel Conclave 2025 will explore leveraging *AI* in the steel value chain and financing the *green transition* for sector growth.\n- Discussions will cover increasing *iron ore availability*, decarbonisation, price risk management, and *logistics* efficiency to build a resilient, future-ready industry in India.\n- The event coincides with government steps such as GST relief on renewable energy products to 5%, helping shift to *green power* and lower emissions.

items.title: Food Min to open chemical lab for food safety
items.summary: - Pralhad Joshi will inaugurate a new chemical laboratory at the National Test House, Ghaziabad, on Sept 10 to bolster quality testing across industries. - The facility will test drinking water, packaging materials, cement and metals, and is NABL accredited to ISO/IEC 17025:2017 with BIS and FSSAI approvals. - Equipped with AAS, GC-MS and HPLC, it plans fortified foods, spices and micronutrient analysis, and will train universities and industries.

items.title: DRDO conclave for MSMEs in UP Defence Corridor
items.summary:
- DRDO's DTTC in Lucknow organized a conclave with *MSMEs* and start-ups to boost *Defence R&D* and support the *Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor*. 
- Over 100 participants discussed *Skill Development*, *R&D funding*, *Technical Consultancy*, and technology transfer by DRDO to advance UP's defence manufacturing ecosystem. 
- The event aligns with *Aatmanirbhar Bharat* and PM Modi's vision, highlighting *MSMEs* as pivotal for a **Viksit Bharat** by 2047.

items.title: CM Stalin concludes Europe visit, returns to Tamil Nadu with ₹15,516 crore investments
Yudh Abhyas 2025: India-US militaries begin rehearsing various battle drills together in Alaska
India Inc revenue to grow 7% this fiscal on GST restructuring, but profit margins may remain flat: Crisil
GST cuts relief for FMCG, apparel, footwear & QSR
items.summary:
- *GST cuts* are expected to boost India's consumption, aiding *FMCG*, *footwear*, *QSRs*, and *grocery retail*.
- *Personal care/home care* GST drops from 12–18% to 5%, improving margins and shopper spend.
- Apparel/footwear GST revised: ₹1,000–₹2,500 at 5%; above ₹2,500 at 18%, benefiting mid-tier brands.

items.title: Qualcomm CEO says Intel’s chip production not good enough yet
items.summary:
- Qualcomm CEO *Cristiano Amon* says *Intel*'s production tech isn't yet suitable to supply Qualcomm's mobile processors.
- He said *Intel* is not an option today, and Qualcomm will continue with *TSMC* and *Samsung* unless Intel improves to become a viable supplier.
- Qualcomm is pushing into automotive with Snapdragon Ride Pilot and targets around **$22 billion** in revenue from automotive and connected devices by 2029, including integration with BMW's iX3.

items.title: Hinduja to invest ₹7,500cr in Tamil Nadu EV
items.summary:
- The *Hinduja Group* will invest ₹7,500 crore to boost Tamil Nadu's EV ecosystem, announced by CM Stalin.
- Tamil Nadu has secured ₹15,516 crore in proposals under the *TN Rising* scheme, expected to create about 17,613 jobs.
- During his London visit, Stalin signed **MoUs** with Wilson Power, Britannia RFID, Exeter, Ecole Intuit Lab, Lloyd's List and Rolls-Royce to advance renewables, education and shipping.

items.title: Trump signs order granting exemptions to some goods
Spectrum sprint: Starlink starts to lay groundwork
Big discounts ahead of GST 2.0: Firms eye fresh demand
items.author: Shally Mohile, Writankar Mukherjee
items.summary:
- *Diwali* discounts jump-start as manufacturers and retailers roll out revised **GST 2.0** rates on cars, TVs, and apparel to clear inventory before Sept 22.
- *Mahindra & Mahindra* cuts prices up to ₹1.43 lakh and absorbs about 70% of the impact; other OEMs are expected to follow by passing on GST 2.0 benefits.
- *CBIC* says the cess burden on pre-GST stock is to be shared by manufacturers and dealers, with about ₹2,500 crore already paid and the post‑Sept 22 tax burden sliding to about 18–40%.

items.title: Vedanta to pour ₹17,000 cr into Jaiprakash Associates, beats Adani bid
Hitachi to invest $1 billion to produce power grid components in US
USFDA issues Form 483 with 8 observations to Aurobindo's Telangana unit
After GST overhaul, retailers point to logistical challenges
Made in UP wine starts selling at retail stores
Uno Minda to invest in solar power SPV for renewable energy sourcing
Solar module exporters look for new markets
items.author: Parag Dave
items.summary:
- **Gujarat-based solar module exporters** face 50% US tariffs, with India exporting about 7 GW of modules to the US worth around ₹10,000 crore, and Gujarat accounting for about 70% of that share.
- *Domestic demand is rising*, exporters will prioritize the Indian market while eyeing new markets in Europe, though Chinese competition may be tough.
- *Industry voices* warn margins will tighten under tariff pressure, but solar energy growth is creating new global opportunities as countries deploy cheaper solar power.

items.title: India’s bioeconomy hits $165.7B, eyes $300B by 2030
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- From $10B in 2014 to $165.7B in 2024, India’s *bioeconomy* targets **$300B** by 2030, driven by *biopharma*, *biomanufacturing*, agriculture and research.
- The sector’s mix is **47%** *bioindustrial*, **35%** *biopharma*, **8%** *bioagri*, **9%** *bioresearch*.
- India is a growing *vaccine hub* with Serum Institute’s 2024 share at 24% (excluding COVID) and 40% of WHO vaccine procurement; ethanol blending reached 20% in petrol by 2025.

items.title: Gujarat and UP take wings in India's global chip flight
items.summary:
- *Gujarat* leads with mega bets, including a $2.75B Micron fab in Sanand and an $11B Tata Electronics-PSMC project in Dholera, anchoring India’s chip map.
- *Uttar Pradesh* shifts strategic gears with the HCL-Foxconn Jewar venture ($435M), targeting 20,000 wafers/month and 36M display-driver chips monthly, by 2027.
- Elsewhere, Assam, Odisha, Punjab and Andhra Pradesh are warming up; a *dual-centre model* grows, but execution hinges on talent, supply chains and stable policy.

items.title: Customer-centric digital manufacturing
items.summary:
- Tata Motors embeds customer voice early via a structured NTD process to push only market-ready ideas.
- Digital twins and the **3DEXPERIENCE** platform accelerate co-development with startups and validate concepts virtually before physical build.
- The shift to *customer experience* and digital continuity links design to delivery, personalization, and lifecycle value.

items.title: Handicraft exporters look to diversify into domestic market
items.summary:
- The 5% GST on handicrafts is aimed at boosting *domestic demand* as exporters tap into India's **140 crore** market.
- Some firms welcome the shift, but layoffs are feared as the order pipeline dries up; growth hinges on diversifying to the **domestic market** and opening new export markets with govt *support*.
- Gems and jewellery GST stays at 3%; long-term relief depends on new markets and policies like *market assistance funds* to help exporters attend global fairs.

items.title: Dassault to take majority stake in jet JV with Reliance
items.summary: - Dassault will buy 2% stake to raise its share to **51%** in the Dassault Reliance Aerospace JV for ₹176 crore.\n- The deal values the JV at ₹8,798 crore and strengthens *Nagpur*-based manufacturing of Rafale and Falcon jet components.\n- By 2028, Falcon 2000 jets will be made in *India* for the first time outside France, with a backlog of 75 Falcons and FY25 turnover ₹70 crore.

items.title: Hansgrohe to quadruple India production as China slows
items.summary:
- Hansgrohe plans to *quadruple India production* as *China sales slow*, boosting diversification in a fast-growing market.
- Mumbai will scale to *200,000 fittings annually by 2028*, with India projected to contribute *10% of global sales by 2030*.
- The push includes expanding distributors to *400* and opening an experience centre in *New Delhi* for live demos.

items.title: L&T Semicon acquires FGEL power module assets
items.summary: - L&T Semiconductor Technologies has acquired *R&D equipment*, *design patents* and *intellectual property* related to Fujitsu General Electronics' *power module* technologies. - This acquisition strengthens LTSCT's *global intellectual property* portfolio and *design capabilities*, aligning with its vision to deliver world-class semiconductor solutions worldwide. - The deal will accelerate LTSCT's foray into *power electronics design* and broaden its portfolio across *industrial*, *energy* and *automotive* applications, FGEL's Tadashi Hasegawa noted.

items.title: MNCs eye JVs in India's semiconductor sector - Yes Securities
items.summary:
- MNCs are eyeing joint ventures to enter India's semiconductor sector, signaling rising external interest *Yes Securities*.
- Government incentives and programs (**fab incentives**, **DLI**, **PLI**, **ISM 2.0**) aim to lift value addition to 30–35% and grow the market toward $100–110B by 2030.
- India's design and IP ambitions are advancing with 23 chip-design projects sanctioned and ~72 companies granted EDA tools, positioning the country as a global hub.

items.title: No reduction in overall cargo shipments from India: Sonowal
items.summary:
- *Sonowal* said there has been no reduction in overall cargo shipments from India despite the 50% tariff on Indian goods. 
- Almost 90% of India's foreign trade by volume and 70% by value is moved by sea. 
- Five rounds of US talks are ongoing amid tariff tensions; VOC Port's green hydrogen project signals maritime sector progress.

items.title: GST reforms will mitigate US tariff impact on Indian economy, says secondary steel industry body
items.summary:
- *GST reforms* will boost demand and help the *secondary steel sector*, mitigating the impact of US tariffs on the Indian economy, according to Yogesh Mandhani.
- He called for *mining policy reforms* to increase *iron ore availability* and lower raw material costs, which could boost exports and steel competitiveness.
- He urged *one nation one tariff* with power tariff rationalisation and a push into export markets to lift capacity utilisation (current ~68–70%).

items.title: Government to greenlight incentives for green steel output
items.summary:
- The government is firming up a **Green Steel Mission** with a **₹5,000 crore** package to incentivise sustainable steel production for both primary and secondary producers. 
- The plan includes **concessional loans**, **risk guarantees**, and incentives for **renewable energy** and a **Production Linked Incentive** to push cleaner tech in secondary steel producers using *electric arc furnaces* and *induction furnaces*. 
- It could launch after approvals in the next financial year as officials seek to close gaps in technology adoption to meet India's **net-zero** targets.

items.title: Sonowal inaugurates port-based green hydrogen at VOC Port
items.summary:
- The 10 Nm³/hr VOC Port pilot will generate **green hydrogen** to power streetlights and an EV charging station, at a cost of ₹3.87 crore. 
- Foundation stones for **green methanol bunkering** (750 m³) and the **Coastal Green Shipping Corridor** (Kandla–Tuticorin) signal broader port decarbonisation efforts. 
- Rooftop solar to 1.04 MW, a ₹24.5 crore link conveyor, a 6 MW wind farm, a ₹90 crore multi-cargo berth, and MoUs with **IPRCL** and **NTPC** boost rail connectivity and green mobility.

items.title: JK Cement to invest ₹3,000 crore in new Jaisalmer plant
items.summary:
- JK Cement has started a *greenfield cement plant* in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, with an investment of about **₹3,000 crore** on 525 acres. 
- The project, slated for completion by early 2027, leverages limestone reserves for raw material security and aims to boost regional employment and skill development in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Haryana. 
- It will deploy technologies such as *waste heat recovery* to improve energy efficiency and support India’s infrastructure and housing needs with a lower carbon footprint.
